Bonar, Mrs. Harry

1. INTERESTING HISTORY

What year did you start homesteading in Western Canada? [January 1926]

What was your first occupation? [Homesteader]

For how many years did you live there? [Ten years]

How far is it to your nearest town? [10 miles]

How often could you visit by mail to the store? [Possibly bi-weekly]

What groceries did you usually buy in those earlier years?

And what other supplies did you purchase? [Meat, flour, sugar, etc.]

As a homesteader, was it hard?

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? [The Royal Canadian]

In what quantities did you buy it? [100 lbs.]

Was flour milled locally? [Yes]

How much did you pay per hundred pounds of white flour? [About $3.00]

What was the usual price for a twenty pound bag of flour? [Not specified]

Did you grow any other crops? [Yes]

Did you find your own wheat for perishing? [Yes]

How did you grind it? [With the grinding stones which we used]

To earn grain for our stock.
1915

Bonar, Mrs. Harry
Fontillas.

Address: 1000 N. Main St., Wichita, Kansas

Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Santa Fe National Archives, P.O. Box 100, University of New Mexico, Albuquerque, New Mexico.

Name: Mrs. Harry Bonar
Address: 1000 N. Main St., Wichita, Kansas

1. FAMILY HISTORY

What year did you start homesteading? In October 1915.
How many people did you have living with you at that time? 7
How far was it to your nearest store? 1 mile
How often could you visit the store? Probably once a month
What groceries did you usually buy in those pleasant years?
And what meat did you purchase? Pork, beef, and mutton.

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of flour did you use in the early years? The Royal Coach
How much flour did you buy? 100 lbs.
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of flour? About $3.00
How much did you use per week? 20 lbs.
Where did you get your flour? Locally
What was the price for a twenty-pound bag of flour? $1.00
What other products did you use? Cornmeal, beans, rice
Did you find your own wheat for flour? Yes
How did you grind it? With the grinding stones which we use
No electric grain for our flour.
